title: South-eastern District
description: A district of sturdy utility, where the clash of steel from the blacksmith's forge mingles with sounds of combat training. Though the Apothecary's death left his shop empty, and the training ring lies in ruins, the district maintains its vital role in the hamlet's defense.
summary: southeast_district (South-eastern District) -- A district of utility focused on defense, where the blacksmith's forge and training areas are central.

title: Blacksmith
description: A stone and timber workshop built around its massive forge, smoke perpetually rising from the chimney. The workshop's walls bear racks of half-finished tools and weapons, while the smith's careful notes cover the workbench. A cozy living space occupies the thatched upper level, warmed by the forge's heat from below.
summary: blacksmith (Blacksmith) -- A workshop centered around a massive forge, used for crafting tools and weapons, with a living space above.

title: Guild Hall
description: A tall building of grey stone and dark timber, rising above its neighbors like a stern sentinel. The ground floor houses meeting spaces and equipment storage, while maps and tactical diagrams cover the walls, many marked with notes comparing the hamlet's defenses to former brigand positions.
summary: guild_hall (Guild Hall) -- A tall building serving as a central hub for meetings, equipment storage, and tactical planning for the hamlet's defense.

title: Guild Master's Quarters
description: The shared chamber for the Guild Master and Trainer doubles as a planning office, its walls covered in tactical maps. A heavy desk bears both old brigade documents and current training rosters, while weapon racks display an impressive array of combat styles.
summary: guild_hall__master_quarters (Guild Master's Quarters) -- A shared chamber in the Guild Hall that serves as a planning office, with tactical maps and weapon displays.

title: Instructors' Chamber
description: A long room beneath the Guild Hall's peaked roof, fitted with sturdy beds and weapon racks. Though currently scattered with training manuals and personal effects, several cots remain available for new arrivals.
summary: guild_hall__instructors (Instructors' Chamber) -- A long room in the Guild Hall, fitted with beds and weapon racks, serving as lodging for instructors and new recruits.

title: Training Ring
description: A proper practice arena reduced to debris and splintered timber. The collapsed viewing stands and broken practice dummies speak to the intensity of use rather than poor construction. Iron fixtures and solid foundation stones wait amid the wreckage, ready for restoration.
restored: A proper training arena rebuilt to withstand even the Guild Trainer's most demanding drills. Tiered wooden stands encircle a packed-earth ring, while reinforced practice dummies stand ready for abuse. Brass hooks hold torches for evening practice, though few remain after dark despite the ring's robust reconstruction.
summary: training_ring (Training Ring) -- A proper practice arena with tiered stands and practice dummies, used for intensive combat drills and training.

title: Training Yard
description: A cleared space behind the Guild Hall where the Guild Trainer now drills recruits. Wooden posts serve for weapons practice, while straw targets line the far wall. Though functional, it serves as a constant reminder of the ruined Training Ring's absence.
summary: training_yard (Training Yard) -- A cleared space behind the Guild Hall, used for weapons practice and drilling recruits with posts and straw targets.

title: The Inlet
description: A sheltered cove nestled between weathered rocks, reached by worn steps cut into the cliff face. Unlike the harbor's murky expanse, these waters remain clear enough to see the sandy bottom. Ancient mooring rings suggest it once served fisher-folk, though now it offers only quiet solitude.
summary: inlet (The Inlet) -- A sheltered cove nestled between weathered rocks, with clear waters and ancient mooring rings, once used by fisher-folk.

title: Apothecary
description: A narrow three-story building of dark timber and clouded windows, its faded sign bearing traces of painted herbs - though closer inspection reveals specimens unlike any natural flora. The ground floor shop stands frozen in time since the Apothecary perished in the invasion, the neat precision of its shelves a stark contrast to the wild growths that still mark his sister's experiments.
summary: apothecary (Apothecary) -- A narrow three-story building serving as a shop for remedies and unusual flora, with a history of unusual botanical experiments.

title: Apothecary Shop Floor
description: Tall shelves line the walls, bearing the Apothecary's labeled remedies alongside empty spaces where his sister's more controversial concoctions once stood. The circular depression in the floorboards marks where the Horticulturist's cauldron once sat, its rim still bearing faint traces of the strange fungi she cultivated before taking her research into the Weald.
summary: apothecary__shop (Apothecary Shop Floor) -- The ground floor of the apothecary, with tall shelves for labeled remedies and a circular depression from a former cauldron.

title: Apothecary Parents' Chamber
description: The second floor holds the master bedroom and a modest parlor, preserved as if awaiting the return of the family's elder generation. Dried flowers fill a vase on the bedside table, maintained until the end by their son's careful hand. A writing desk faces the street, its drawer still holding recipes written in their mother's precise hand.
summary: apothecary__second_floor (Apothecary Parents' Chamber) -- The second floor of the apothecary, featuring a master bedroom and parlor, preserved with family memories.

title: Apothecary Children's Rooms
description: Two small bedrooms tucked beneath the eaves tell the story of siblings who chose drastically different paths. The Apothecary's room stands as a monument to restraint, while his sister's chamber remains a testament to ambition unbound - fungi specimens still flourish in forgotten corners, and beneath peeling wallpaper, unsettling formulae speak to her gradual obsession with the Weald's corrupted flora.
summary: apothecary__third_floor (Apothecary Children's Rooms) -- Two small bedrooms beneath the apothecary eaves, reflecting contrasting sibling paths, one with strange fungi specimens.

title: Apothecary Herb Garden
description: A walled garden where the family cultivated medicinal herbs for generations, now bearing visible signs of the Horticulturist's later experiments. While most beds lie neglected, certain patches flourish with unsettling vigor, particularly where her mushroom specimens have spread beyond their bounds. The old well remains sealed with heavy chains, a precaution dating to the days before she left.
summary: apothecary__garden (Apothecary Herb Garden) -- A walled garden once used for medicinal herbs, now showing signs of unusual botanical experiments and unsettling plant growth.
